column2: Senior Plant Maintenance Engineer The company BHS Corrugated India Pvt Ltd, based in Pune is established since 2011 as a subsidiary of BHS Corrugated, Germany. We bring together professional culture and decades of corporate experience. We are working on the digital future of the corrugated cardboard industry. As an independent player, we act as a partner to the entire industry and network manufacturers, customers, and service providers in a unique industrial ecosystem. We use it to create highly efficient and simple processes with the aim of making the corrugated cardboard industry the most innovative and productive industry segment worldwide.  Job Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Mid-Level Maintenance Engineer to join our upcoming Corrugating roll manufacturing facility (Precise Steel Roll manufacturing). The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in installing, commissioning, and maintaining state-of-the-art machines. Additionally, they will collaborate with architects to design mechanical, electrical, and plumbing requirements, and as the production commences, lead a team for ongoing maintenance and expansion. He shall be responsible for maintaining the entire facility, encompassing building systems, electrical infrastructure, mechanical equipment, and material handling systems. This role will also involve managing the licensing process for compliance certificates from government agencies. Knowledge of Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) and Lean Manufacturing principles is essential Main Task:  Install and commission machinery, ensuring proper functionality and adherence to safety standards.  Collaborate with architects to design mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems for optimal factory layout.  Oversee the construction phase, ensuring alignment with technical specifications and compliance with industry regulations.  Manage the licensing process for compliance certificates from government agencies.  Implement Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) practices to optimize equipment reliability and performance.  Apply Lean Manufacturing principles to streamline production processes and reduce waste.  Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules to maximize machine efficiency and minimize downtime.  Maintain building systems, including electrical, mechanical, and plumbing infrastructure.  Monitor expenses and control the budget for maintenance.  Troubleshoot and address technical issues promptly to maintain continuous production flow.  Train and mentor maintenance team members, fostering a culture of safety and excellence.  Coordinate with external vendors for spare parts procurement and equipment upgrades.  Stay abreast of industry trends, recommending technological advancements to enhance production processes. column2: As an Electrical Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient and reliable operation of our biogas production plants. Your responsibilities will include the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of electrical systems and equipment within the plant. Your expertise will contribute to optimizing the plants electrical infrastructure, enhancing efficiency and sustainability.       Key Responsibilities   :     1. Electrical Systems Installation: Install, configure, and maintain electrical systems and equipment, including motors, generators, switchgear, and control panels.     2. Power Distribution: Manage the distribution of electrical power throughout the plant, ensuring consistent and reliable supply to all components.     3. Preventive Maintenance: Develop and execute preventive maintenance plans for electrical systems and equipment to minimize downtime and reduce the risk of failures.     4. Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve electrical issues, faults, and failures promptly to minimize production disruptions.     5. Instrumentation Integration: Collaborate with instrumentation engineers to integrate electrical and instrumentation systems for seamless plant operation.     6. Safety Compliance: Ensure that all electrical systems and installations comply with safety regulations and industry standards.     7. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of electrical maintenance activities, including wiring diagrams, equipment manuals, and maintenance logs.     8. Training: Provide training to plant operators and technicians on the safe operation and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment.       Qualifications:       - Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.   - Proven experience in the operation and maintenance of electrical systems in an industrial environment, preferably in the renewable energy or biogas sector.   - Strong knowledge of electrical systems, including motor controls, electrical distribution, and power generation.   - Familiarity with safety protocols and regulations in an industrial setting.   - Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.   - Strong communication and teamwork skills.   - Ability to work independently and in a team, often in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.   - Flexibility to work on-call and respond to plant emergencies as needed.       Preferred Qualifications:       - Professional certification in electrical engineering.   - Experience with electrical systems in biogas production processes or renewable energy systems.   - Knowledge of automation and control systems.   - Familiarity with maintenance management software.
column11: Electrical engineering, Automation, Switchgear, Renewable energy, Power distribution, Instrumentation, Electrical maintenance, Troubleshooting, Preventive maintenance, Maintenance management

column2: Job Description: As a Mechanical Maintenance Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient and reliable operation of our international industrial facilities. Your responsibilities will include the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of advanced mechanical systems and equipment within the plant, with a focus on optimizing efficiency and sustainability while adhering to international standards. Key Responsibilities: 1.   Mechanical Systems Installation and Configuration:  Undertake the installation, configuration, and maintenance of sophisticated mechanical systems and equipment, such as pumps, compressors, turbines, and conveyors, ensuring compliance with international standards. 2.   Equipment Management:  Oversee the proper functioning and maintenance of mechanical equipment throughout the plant, ensuring optimal performance and longevity. 3.   Preventive Maintenance Planning:  Develop and implement comprehensive preventive maintenance plans for mechanical systems and equipment to minimize downtime and reduce the risk of failures, adhering to global regulatory requirements and utilizing approved maintenance management software. 4.   Advanced Troubleshooting:  Diagnose and promptly resolve complex mechanical issues, faults, and failures to minimize production disruptions, leveraging in-depth technical expertise. 5.   Collaboration with Instrumentation Engineers:  Collaborate with instrumentation engineers to integrate mechanical and instrumentation systems seamlessly, enhancing overall operational efficiency while ensuring compliance with international standards. 6.   Safety Compliance Assurance:  Ensure strict adherence to international safety regulations and industry standards in the design and maintenance of mechanical systems within the industrial environment. 7.   Comprehensive Documentation:  Maintain meticulous records of all mechanical maintenance activities, including detailed diagrams, equipment manuals, and maintenance logs, in line with global regulatory requirements. 8.   Specialized Training:  Provide advanced training to plant operators and technicians, focusing on the safe operation and maintenance of cutting-edge mechanical systems and equipment, as per international standards. Preferred Qualifications: Professional certification in mechanical engineering. Demonstrated experience with mechanical systems in industrial settings on an international scale. Expertise in automation and control systems relevant to mechanical processes. Familiarity with maintenance management software approved by global regulatory authorities. Role:  International Compliance Mechanical Maintenance Engineer Industry Type:  Industrial  Department:  Production, Manufacturing & Engineering  Employment Type:  Full Time, Permanent Role  Category:  Operations, Maintenance & Support  Education:  UG: Any Graduate PG: Any Postgraduate

column2: A Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining systems that use artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) algorithms to solve complex problems.      Developing and implementing ML algorithms: The Machine Learning Engineer develops and implements machine learning algorithms to solve specific problems, such as natural language processing, computer vision, or predictive modeling.     Building data pipelines: The Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for building data pipelines that collect, store, and preprocess data used in machine learning algorithms.     Creating and maintaining ML infrastructure: The Machine Learning Engineer is responsible for creating and maintaining ML infrastructure, including hardware, software, and cloud platforms, that support the development and deployment of ML models.     Testing and validating ML models: The Machine Learning Engineer tests and validates ML models, ensuring that they are accurate, robust, and scalable.     Troubleshooting ML systems: The Machine Learning Engineer troubleshoots ML systems, identifying and resolving issues related to performance, accuracy, and scalability.     Deploying ML models: The Machine Learning Engineer deploys ML models in production environments, integrating them with other software systems and ensuring that they are reliable and scalable.

column2: The new SEAM organization integrates Safety, Environment & Asset Management activities, with a broad geographical footprint, that will support Shell''s business & assets around the world. The vision of SEAM is to provide capability across the spectrum of Safety, Environment and Asset Management with: shaping the future ways of working through introducing to the business new technology and news way of working, including e.g., digital, SBO, and real-time, data-driven, end-to-end optimization and risk management, but also global projects like Human Performance Based Safety Philosophy. providing performance feedback driving disciplined execution to deliver reliable, predictable results helping the businesses build their improvement plans and provide support to execute them sustaining performance through strong core capabilities (internal, including SBO & contingent) through building expertise and a company-wide consistent approach The VP TAO will be accountable for maximizing integrated business value across the organization. Technical Asset Operations (TAO) is a key enabler for the accelerated delivery of Shell''s Asset Management System and will help us to reach our ultimate potential in Downstream Manufacturing, Integrated Gas and Upstream. TAO provides high quality and cost-competitive technical resources who are not physically present at site yet are an integral part of asset teams delivering value through end-to-end AMS work processes. The role is expected to provide detailed job plans for PM/CM activities. Understand the complexities and details of work planning with preventive and corrective maintenance activities and Prepare comprehensive work packs/task lists for preventive/corrective maintenance Field electrical equipment, Transformers, MOV''s, Electric motors, lighting, switching and controls, Battery system, Electrical Heat Trace, substation equipment, control system and idea of transmission/operation at HV/LV voltage level in Oil & gas industry, Refinery, Petrochemical industry by studying the operations and maintenance manuals of OEMs, general task lists, equipment specific task lists, Test certificates, maintenance reports, spare part list, preventive maintenance strategies etc., and technical discussions with global, site maintenance leads/technical authorities & OEMs/Vendors etc., Prepare preventive/corrective maintenance activities work pack and support maintenance and reliability engineers as assigned from end-to-end basis initial respond, carry out assessment, ensure correct prioritization of work, troubleshoot & propose technical solutions virtually, co-ordinate discussion with stakeholders, conduct Risk Assessment, ensure good QA/QC, record keeping, & final job closure to enable high equipment reliability & plant technical availability. Understand the machinery constructions and maintenance methods such as proactive / preventive / corrective maintenance being followed in operating units and assist them in making changes and improve readiness of maintenance with sufficient time before maintenance activities begin. Purpose & Accountabilities Primary responsibility in preparing/developing work plan with comprehensive workpacks from Calibration reports, maintenance reports, general tasklist, equipment specific task lists, spare part list, equipments drawings, circuit diagrams, P&IDs,instrument logics, cause & effects,Equipment data sheets, operation and maintenance manuals of OEMs etc., for Field electrical equipment, HV/LV Transformers, MOV''s, Electric motors, lighting, switching and controls etc., for various operating units as per Shell Standards. Building work packs include detailed description of the tasks that need to be performed for maintenance of each Instruments, parts required, tools required, time required and relationship between tasks including the pre-work preperation steps. The Electrical Corrective Planner provides quality, fit for purpose Corrective and PM plans including site preparations, parts, recommended improvements, vendor requirements, contacts, support equipment and resources in the correct task sequence for efficient scheduling and cost-effective execution. Assist with the development and implementation of Corrective and Preventative Maintenance plans for Routine Maintenance in compliance with AMS ME Practices and in alignment with Planning, Finance and C&P processes.  Manage Instrument/Electrical backlog as per LAFD (50%) for routine maintenance, escalation when any risk or roadblocks for resolution, perform to standing SCT planning KPI''s WO''s will be delegated by Senior Planner  GSAP/Blueprint proficient, vetted and verified by SCT planning supervisor Maintain plan quality performance expectations less than 2% re-plan frequency Deliver accurate/high-quality plans as per SCT performance planning KPI''s Manage stakeholder relationships through proficient communication both written and verbal to attain information and documentation in a timely manner Competent Cost awareness: Communication of significant plan cost increases to budget holder, including variances ($$) from initial cost estimates through senior planner involvement Participate and comply with all safety programs, SOP''s, SWP''s, plan standards Assist with the continuous improvement and implementation of standardized work processes for effective cost and budget control Stay current with mandatory training in Shell e-learnings and additional unit and facility requirements  Planning Work orders in SAP/GSAP and building library work packs that include detailed description of the tasks that need to be performed for time & condition-based maintenance, breakdown maintenance, ordering parts required, service or tools required, estimating time required, Estimating cost of work order, network mapping and quality check points for minimum assurance tasks. Job hazard assessment, setting out risks anticipated required while performing tasks and creating Permit to work.  Identifying the system condition for each operation activity tasks should be ascertained about the shutdown windows availability or suitable opportunities for maintenance activities. Planning of end-to-end work orders to enable efficient scheduling and ensure compliance of executable work orders. First level diagonisis of damage history, determining the failure mode based on anomaly reports and informtion given in corrective maintenance work request/ notification. Investigating and analysis of CM work requset to identify the true cause of the problem and prepare work orders with the detailed tasks to repair the damage with as much as detailed information required to complete the job effectively including procedures, sketches, specifications, or drawings deemed necessary. Improving productivity by ensuring the resource, special tool, material, and service requirements availability before the job begins. Customize the equipment make and model specific work packs into site specific work pack by adding site conditions and parameters. Accommodate the PM library changes by converting the turnaround documents to the global work packs. Constantly engage with site maintenance leads, original equipment manufacturers, vendors and modify the work packs as recommended/required by the site maintenance personnels.  Anticipate & plan for mandatory spares, tools and tackles and manpower required for the Instruments, control valves, level instruments and damper equipment''s based on the information extracted from maintenance manuals, collate any additional information about Instruments & its spares, if required from the vendors and accommodate the information in the work pack. Dimensions Adhering to safety by ensuring all work plans are planned in the safest manner possible with a focus on goal zero. Hazards are identified through field visits and mitigated with an emphasis on safe field execution. Confidence to work in virtual environment and managing engagement across different levels of stakeholders, including senior management for day-to-day operations. Includes initiativeto identify and help resolve business and technical issues within areas of responsibility.  Sound understanding of business/process workflow and having mature mindset to deal and behave under tough/challenging situations. Strong proficiency in using English for both spoken and written communication, as well as using Skype for Business, Instant Messaging, Video Conferencing, Outlook, etc. Shift work following operating hours of production sites/ Plants.  Resilient under pressure and able to work with people different culture and working style. Willing to travel to various operating units/sites across the globe as per requirements. A self-starter leader and reliable deliverer, with very good verbal and written skills in English, able to negotiate with people, and able to resist undue influence that might otherwise compromise integrity of data quality. Exposes the individual to all cultural backgrounds and organizational levels, across diverse time zones. Sound understanding of business/process workflow and having mature mindset to deal and behave under tough/challenging situations. The role will involve working in shifts (Afternoon/Evening/Late Evening Shifts) to have enough interface with the asset/plant to be supported remotely/virtually. Shift work follows Dutch working hours. Skills & Requirements University Degree or Diploma in Electrical, Electrical & Electronics Engineering. Minimum 5 + years of working experience in Field electrical systems, equipment''s and controls and automation systems in Oil & Gas/ Refinery/ Petrochemicals Industry and in one or more of following areas: - Installation & commissioning/operations & maintenance of Electrical equipment viz. Transformers, MOV''s, Electric motors, lighting, switching and controls, Battery system, substation equipment, control system and idea of transmission/operation at HV/LV voltage level etc. Experience in preparing/planning the maintenance work instructions, task lists, work packs, work, and manpower estimation for major maintenance/overhauling of Electrical equipment viz. Transformers, MOV''s, Electric motors, lighting, switching and controls, Battery system, substation equipment, control system and idea of transmission/operation at HV/LV voltage level etc. utilizing SAP software. Experience in materials or resources to be ordered, in advance of the work order being issued, such that the scheduler can immediately bring the work order into the schedule without any intervention, Participated and supported ISO/safety-MS audits, as well as other related external audits, as part of Company Safety Control framework and management system. Performed Instrument equipment condition monitoring whenever required & liaise with relevant subject matter experts/specialist/OEM to address any arising issues, problems & concerns. Provide Instrument support to other maintenance discipline, provide support and allocate required resources for Turnaround execution. Proficient: understanding P&ID drawings / isometric drawings /schematic drawings/ loop drawings Proficient: EHT troubleshooting and installation, MOV''s, Electric motors, lighting, switching and controls Hands on Experience in Plant Maintenance Area as an engineering/end user of SAP PM Module/ Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)/Document Management System etc., Electrical maintenance & exposure to work planning for field electrical equipment -Desirable  Experience in leading team/process/projects is preferred. Experience in Technical Data and Documents management including processes and tools. For example, experience in SAP PM module implementation, skill in MS Office tools like Excel and Access etc.  Awareness in SPI In-tools specification and wiring model, control valve training etc., shall be an added advantage. Knowledge of SAP PM is preferable. Effective communication skill and stakeholder management is a necessary skill for the job. Strong aptitude for Learner Mindset Flexibility to move quickly across changing priorities and manage multiple Projects. Ability to independently, resourcefully, and creatively research and implement new solutions. A good understanding of the Upstream/DS/IG business and how it works. Ability to engage and effectively communicate at all levels inside and outside Shell and within different cultural settings.  Strong interpersonal skills, ability to challenge and ability to build internal and external relationships based on trust and to integrate across multiple functions. Continuous Improvement

Your work will be focused on workspace solutions, providing direct support for your colleagues as well as design and implementation new solutions within our IT landscape. Document relevant information and ensure that the customer (colleague) is communicated with in a timely manner on a level that they understand. column2: Company Description TOKAI RIKA MINDA INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED is a Autoparts manufacturing company based in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India.  Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a Maintenance Engineer at TOKAI RIKA MINDA INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED. The Maintenance Engineer will be responsible for day-to-day equipment maintenance, conducting maintenance and repair tasks, performing preventive maintenance activities, and ensuring electrical maintenance is carried out effectively. The role requires strong problem-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and repair machinery efficiently. Key Responsibilities: Conduct routine inspections and maintenance of mold machines to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime. Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic issues with mold machines. Perform repairs and adjustments to mold machines as needed, including replacing worn or damaged parts. Coordinate with production teams to schedule maintenance activities and minimize disruptions to manufacturing operations. Develop and implement preventive maintenance programs for mold machines to prevent breakdowns and extend equipment lifespan. Collaborate with engineering and design teams to identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions to enhance machine efficiency and productivity. Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment performance, and spare parts inventory. Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies to maintain a safe working environment for all employees.  Knowledge on PLC, HMI Experience. Spare Management, ISOTS/ EMS Audit system. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in electrical & Electronics Engineering, or related field. Previous experience working with mold machines in a manufacturing environment. Strong technical skills with the ability to diagnose and repair mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems. Proficiency in reading technical manuals, schematics, and blueprints. Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Knowledge of preventive maintenance practices and reliability-centered maintenance principles. Familiarity with safety regulations and protocols related to mold machine operations.
column11: Moulds, Plastic Injection Molding, Utility Maintenance, Maintenance of Moulding Machine, Injection Moulding, Electrical Maintenance, TPM, Breakdown Maintenance, Predictive Maintenance, Preventive Maintenance, Machine Maintenance, Mechanical Maintenance

column2: Role & responsibilities   1)  Operation & Maintenance   of Utilities :- 1) Steam Boilers - Boiler annual inspection work, maintenance of accessories, water softners, pressure reducing valves, steam traps. 2) Chilling plants (water & brine) compressors (Kirloskar, Voltas & blue Star make  3) Air compressors (Reciprocating-Ingersol Rand & Elgi make),  4) Air compressor (screw air compr- Atlas copco make). 5) Cooling towers-forced draft (Paharpur make) & natural draft. 6) Power generators -Diesel Generators 1000 KVA , Cummins make  4 nos.  7) Safety devices- safety relief valves, rupture discs, flame arrestors. 8) Air conditioning & refrigeration, water coolers, canteen equipments, 9) Weighing balances, Forklifts and all Lifting tools & tackles (chain blocks, lifting slings) for their maintenance & certification etc.  10) Water management system, Cooling Tower & Boiler water treatment. 11)  Fire Hydrant System pumps & Fire Trailor pumps. 12) R&D & QC Labs equipments like blower , vacuum pump , metering pump preventive maintenance.  2)   Other Activities: 1) Responsibility of shop floor maintenance, administration, material & manpower management and Safety, Health & Environment (SHE) management activity.  2) Maintaining the history of equipments by proper data bank in computer. Preparing the check lists & reports. Vendor development for in plant maintenance in emergencies 3) Documentation for ISO-9001, 14000 & 18000 (IMS) for regular review & certification.  4) Coding of new items in Engineering Item Master with proper specifications & studying the ROL/ROQ for managing the inventory, considering the plant's priorities & requirements.  3) Fabrication & Projects:- Fabrication of piping (MS, SS, HDPE, GI, Teflon lined, PVC,) as per P & Ids & layout of equipments. Installation of equipments & their piping as per processes. Co-ordination of rigging, scaffolding, civil jobs, painting & other resources management required for the jobs. Execution of modification projects related to capacity augmentation, process modification & considering hazops with aid of project planning techniques. Complete commissioning of the project. Work certification & billing. Annual plant shutdown work, planning & estimation, manpower, material & resources management complete with administration formalities. Documents updating as per statutory requirement.  4) Man-power management:   Guiding site staff members to address and resolve      performance bottlenecks. Addressing training needs of site staff to enhance skills and productivity, safety, health & environment awareness.    Preferred candidate profile   BE / BTECH MECHANICAL 7 TO 10 Years Experience Perks and benefits   5 LPA TO 10 LPA

column2: Job Description  We are seeking an experienced Maintenance Engineer to join our team in the pharmaceutical plant, responsible for ensuring the optimal performance and reliability of our tablet and capsule manufacturing equipment. The successful candidate will have a strong background in mechanical maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair, with experience in a GMP environment. Qualification:  Degree/Diploma in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering Responsibilities Perform routine maintenance, repairs, and overhauls on tablet and capsule manufacturing equipment, including presses, coaters, and packaging lines. Troubleshoot and resolve equipment issues, minimizing downtime and ensuring production schedules are met. Implement preventative maintenance programs to reduce equipment failure and extend lifespan. Collaborate with production staff to identify and address equipment performance issues. Implement maintenance procedures and standard operating procedures (SOPs). Ensure compliance with GMP regulations, company policies, and industry standards. Manage spare parts inventory  Provide technical training and support to other maintenance staff and production personnel. Required Skill Set  3-5 years and above in pharmaceutical manufacturing facility. Must speak, read and write  English fluently . Strong communication and verbal skills Team working and interpersonal skills Innovative and results driven

column2: Hiring for Big Healthcare Enterprise-Kirloskar Technologies Private Limited. (Part of Kirloskar Group) Position Hiring: Senior Service Engineers/Service Engineers/Jr. Service Engineers for Pan India No. of Vacancies: 200 (Looking for Experience Only) Company Profile:  About Kirloskar Technologies: Popularly known as KTPL, it has been a successful healthcare enterprise for more than two decades. KTPL is part of more than 100-year-old, 1.2 billion US dollar conglomerate, the Kirloskar Group. We have handled scores of projects, from procurement to installation and maintenance of medical equipment in the fields of oncology, radiology, gynecology, neurosurgery, imaging, diagnostics, and many more disciplines. KTPL is convinced that efficient, timely equipment maintenance is vital for the health care delivery system. KTPL has been empanelled as knowledge Partner by National Health Systems Resources Centre Ministry of Health, Government of India. KTPL has been selected to maintain all the biomedical equipment in the states of Kerala, Rajasthan, Punjab, and Odisha facilities under PPP model. Position Objective: Responsibilities include planning and managing the services of medical equipment and optimal use of resources. Job Responsibilities:   Service Support: Responsible for providing periodic maintenance services, timely resolution for equipment malfunction, troubleshooting, and repair of electronic and electromechanical equipment onsite service.  Preventive and Corrective maintenance of  Biomedical  Equipment. Coordinate with service contractors for maintenance, calibration, and collection of service documents. Training customers on equipment operation, maintenance procedures and process related to the upkeep of equipment. Key Account/Customer Relationship Management: Responsible for building and managing key customers as well as building and strengthening customer relations by timely follow up and support to the customers. Responsible for the closure of all assigned calls. Timely submission of documents (service reports, PM reports, etc.) to the branch office. Responsible for the daily scheduling of engineers and providing daily updates to BSM. Follow up with the service coordinator for spares required to rectify the equipment. Responsible for grooming of Engineers technicians reporting to him. Education and Experience Requirements:  B.E/B.Tech in Biomedical Engineering/ Medical Electronics/ Electronics & Electrical / Electronics & Telecommunication, and Instrumentation. Diploma in Electronics Engineering, Electronics & Telecommunications, or Electrical Engineering. Experience: 3-7 years. Expertise in the repair, calibration, and maintenance of medical equipment. High level of customer focus and good communication skills with a pleasing personality. Self-motivated and self-directed with the ability to create and manage their own schedule. WE REQUIRE AMBITIOUS PEOPLE WITH PROFESSIONAL IMAGE, GOOD ATTITUDE, AND MENTALITY TO GROW WITH THE COMPANY.   Salary Range: Salary will not be a constraint for the right candidate, and it may vary based on experience and skill set.
column11: Biomedical Engineering, Service Engineering, Medical Devices, Medical Equipment, X-Ray, Ventilation, Servicing, Biomedical

column2: Team Management: Oversee a team of service technicians, coordinators, and support staff      Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to ensure efficient and effective service operations      Set performance expectations, conduct regular performance evaluations, and provide feedback to team members      Service Delivery: Ensure the timely and successful delivery of services to customers      Coordinate service requests, assign tasks to technicians, and monitor progress to ensure customer satisfaction and adherence to service level agreements (SLAs)      Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with customers by understanding their needs, addressing concerns, and ensuring exceptional service delivery      Act as a point of contact for escalated customer issues and work towards resolution      Service Planning and Scheduling: Plan and schedule service activities, including preventive maintenance, repairs, and installations      Coordinate with customers, technicians, and suppliers to optimize service delivery and minimize downtime      Resource Allocation and Inventory Management: Allocate resources, including technicians, equipment, and parts, to ensure efficient service operations      Manage inventory levels, order parts and supplies as needed, and maintain accurate records of stock and usage      Quality Assurance: Monitor service quality and ensure adherence to established standards and procedures      Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery, efficiency, and customer satisfaction      Conduct regular audits or inspections to identify areas for improvement      Financial Management: Manage service budgets, monitor expenses, and implement cost control measures      Analyze financial data, such as service revenue, profitability, and expenses, to identify opportunities for revenue growth and operational efficiency      Training and Development: Develop and deliver training programs to enhance the technical skills and knowledge of service technicians      Stay updated with industry trends, new technologies, and best practices in service management      Provide coaching and professional development opportunities to team members      Safety and Compliance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies      Promote a culture of safety and ensure that service technicians adhere to safety guidelines and use appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) when performing their duties      Reporting and Documentation: activities, customer interactions, and equipment service histories

column2: To lead the Maintenance System administration & deployment for ams OSRAM?s most advanced 200mm Wafer     Fabrication start-up site to be constructed in Kulim, Malaysia.     The Maintenance system(s) are namely, SAP PM, OPRA, Computerized Maintenance Management System     (CMMS) and Augmented Reality (AR) for maintenance activities will be use in the new site.     Learn, develop, and deploy the necessary Maintenance System competencies from our headquarters in     Regensburg to the new site.     Deploy the desired modules of the Maintenance Systems planned for the start-up site to enable the Wafer Fab to ramp up production and run in a seamless manner.     Integrate the necessary Maintenance Systems and sub-systems into the overall system architecture.     Author requirement/functional specifications for new/existing Maintenance Systems and modules and/or solutions.     Design test cases and test scenarios and perform black box testing for system capabilities introduced and document them in our test management system.     Champion the introduction of advance concepts such as Planned, Predictive, Prescriptive Maintenance using integration to SECS/GEM Host acquired data be it Alarms, Events, KPVs, etc.     To perform administrative functions of the Maintenance Systems such as Master Data Management, Reporting, Disposition, etc.     Design PL/SQL Triggers, Functions, etc. to integrate other sub-systems into the respective Maintenance Systems.     Train and support production use of the Maintenance Systems.     Provide 2nd level support and resolution for Maintenance System related incidents.     Lead &; train the 24x7 1st level support team to adequately support the incidents observed in the line.           Requirements:           Master/bachelor?s degree in Computer Science, Electrical & Electronics, Mechatronics, Computer     Engineering, IT or equivalent.     Three or more years of experience working with Maintenance Related system, e.g: SAP PM, IBM     MAXIMO or eMaint CMMS.     One or more years of experience working with Augmented Reality (AR) tools to assist maintenance activities, e.g.: Microsoft HoloLens.     Experienced and knowledgeable in SEMI Standards, namely E-004 (SECS-I), E-005 (SECS-II), E-010 (RAM), E-030(GEM), E-037 (HSMS) and E-142 Substrate Mapping is sought for this role.     Familiarity with common CIM components such as SPC, RMS, R2R, and FDC are highly desired.     Familiarity with web technologies such as VB.NET, C#.NET, web services, SOAP and XML will be       advantageous.       Proficient in database technologies and PL/SQL statements. column2: Role & responsibilities     Equipment Maintenance: ?The primary responsibility is to ensure the smooth functioning of machinery and equipment on the industrial site. This involves conducting regular inspections, troubleshooting issues, and performing repairs or replacements as necessary. Preventive Maintenance: Implementing and managing preventive maintenance programs to minimize downtime and maintain optimal equipment performance. This includes scheduling regular maintenance tasks, such as lubrication, cleaning, and calibration. Emergency Repairs: Responding to equipment breakdowns or emergencies to minimize downtime and production losses. This may require working outside of regular hours or being on-call. Safety and Compliance: Ensuring that maintenance activities comply with safety regulations and company policies. This includes conducting safety inspections and implementing corrective actions as needed. Upgrades: Identifying opportunities for improving equipment reliability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness. This may involve recommending upgrades or modifications to existing equipment. Documentation: Keeping detailed records of maintenance activities, including repairs, replacements, and preventive maintenance tasks. This documentation is important for tracking equipment performance and compliance with regulations. Inventory Management: Maintaining an inventory of spare parts and equipment to ensure timely repairs and replacements. This involves identifying critical spare parts and ensuring their availability. Preferred candidate profile     Education : A bachelor's degree in mechanical, electrical, or industrial engineering is required. Or relevant technical diploma or certification. Experience : Previous experience in maintenance, preferably in a manufacturing environment, is required.? Technical Skills : Proficiency in troubleshooting and repairing mechanical, electrical, and/or industrial equipment is essential. Knowledge of hydraulics, pneumatics, and other relevant systems may be required. Problem-Solving Skills : Ability to quickly identify and resolve equipment issues to minimize downtime and maintain production schedules. Communication Skills : Effective communication with team members, supervisors, and other departments to coordinate maintenance activities and report on equipment status. Computer Skills : ?Proficiency in using MS Office and other software tools for maintenance planning, inventory management, and documentation.  Perks and benefits   Apart from the salary, company offers different types of benefit like PF, insurance, wellness programs, etc.
column11: Safety and Compliance, Equipment Maintenance, Electrical Maintenance, Plant Maintenance, Inventory Management, Emergency Repairs, Repair, Servicing

column2: Key Responsibilities: Electrical Maintenance:  Perform routine and preventive maintenance on all electrical systems and equipment, including motors, transformers, switchgear, control systems, and power distribution networks. Troubleshooting:  Diagnose and repair electrical faults in a timely manner to minimize plant downtime. This includes using diagnostic tools and equipment to identify issues and implement effective solutions. Operational Support:  Provide electrical engineering support to ensure continuous and efficient operation of the oxygen plant. Assist in the start-up, shutdown, and routine operation of electrical systems. Safety Compliance:  Ensure all electrical work is performed in accordance with safety regulations and standards. Conduct regular safety inspections and audits, and participate in safety training programs. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of all maintenance and repair activities, including work orders, maintenance logs, and electrical schematics. Update documentation as necessary to reflect changes and improvements. Project Management:  Participate in electrical engineering projects, including equipment upgrades, installations, and modifications. Coordinate with other departments and external contractors as required. Emergency Response:  Respond promptly to emergency situations and power outages, providing technical expertise to restore operations safely and quickly. Qualifications & Skills : Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in electrical maintenance and engineering within Oxygen Plant. Proficiency in using electrical diagnostic tools and equipment. Strong understanding of electrical systems, control systems, and automation. Familiarity with PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers) and SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems. Knowledge of electrical codes and safety standards.

column2: \Equipment Maintenance:     Perform routine inspections, maintenance, and repairs on electrical equipment, including transformers, motors, switchgear, generators, and control systems.   Conduct diagnostic tests and troubleshooting to identify and resolve electrical malfunctions, equipment failures, and power outages.   Ensure compliance with electrical codes, regulations, and safety standards in all maintenance activities.   Preventive Maintenance:     Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules and procedures to proactively identify and address potential issues before they lead to equipment failure.   Conduct predictive maintenance tasks, such as thermographic inspections, vibration analysis, and oil analysis, to detect early signs of equipment degradation.   Emergency Response:     Respond promptly to emergency situations, such as electrical failures, equipment breakdowns, or power outages, to minimize downtime and restore operations.   Coordinate with other maintenance teams, contractors, and external service providers to expedite repairs and ensure continuity of operations.   Spare Parts Management:     Maintain inventory of electrical spare parts, components, and consumables necessary for maintenance activities.   Monitor stock levels, reorder supplies as needed, and manage procurement processes to ensure availability of critical parts.

column2: Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance on electrical systems and equipment to ensure optimal performance. Repair or replace faulty electrical components, such as motors, transformers, circuit breakers, and switches.     Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, fixtures, and control systems.     Conduct regular inspections of electrical panels, wiring, and connections to identify potential hazards or code violations. Keep accurate records of maintenance activities, including work performed, parts used, and equipment condition in CNC/VMC       Job Summary:     ?         We are seeking a skilled and experienced CNC/VMC Maintenance Electrical Technician to join our team     As a Maintenance Electrical Technician, you will be responsible for ensuring the safe and efficient operation of electrical systems and equipment in our facility     Your primary focus will be on preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, and repairing electrical systems to minimize downtime and maximize productivity           Qualifications:         total work: 1 year (Preferred)     Benefits:      Health insurance     Leave encashment     Life insurance     Paid time off     Provident Fund

column2: As a Maintenance Engineer - Electrical, your role involves ensuring the proper functioning and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment within an organization     You are responsible for troubleshooting electrical issues, performing repairs and preventive maintenance, and implementing electrical safety measures     Here are some key aspects of your role:Equipment Maintenance: You conduct routine inspections, maintenance, and calibration of electrical equipment and systems to ensure optimal performance and adherence to manufacturer specifications     This includes transformers, motors, generators, control panels, switchgear, and other electrical components     Troubleshooting and Repairs: You diagnose and troubleshoot electrical faults and failures, identifying the root causes of problems and implementing appropriate solutions     This may involve repairing or replacing faulty components, wiring, or circuits     Preventive Maintenance: You develop and implement preventive maintenance programs to minimize unplanned downtime and extend the lifespan of electrical systems     This includes creating maintenance schedules, conducting inspections, and performing routine maintenance tasks such as cleaning, lubrication, and component replacements     Electrical Safety: You ensure compliance with electrical safety standards and regulations, such as NFPA 70E or IEC 60364, and implement safety protocols and practices     This includes conducting safety audits, performing electrical safety tests, and training personnel on electrical safety procedures     Documentation and Reporting: You maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment status, and repairs performed     You generate reports on equipment performance, maintenance costs, and recommendations for improvements or upgrades     Energy Efficiency: You identify opportunities to improve energy efficiency and reduce electricity consumption within the organization     This may involve analyzing energy usage, implementing energy-saving measures, and recommending the use of more efficient equipment or technologies
column11: Training, Report generation, Switchgear, Compliance, Transformers, Saving, Equipment maintenance, Safety audit, Troubleshooting, Preventive maintenance

As an Assistant Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient operation and maintenance of electrical systems within our facilities. Perform preventive maintenance tasks such as cleaning, lubricating, and adjusting electrical components to ensure optimal performance and longevity. Collaborate with other members of the maintenance team to schedule and prioritize maintenance tasks.     Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including repairs, replacements, and inspections.     Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and regulations related to electrical maintenance.     Assist in the development of maintenance procedures and protocols to improve efficiency and safety.     Provide support during equipment installations, upgrades, or modifications.     Ensure compliance with all relevant safety standards and regulations.

Ltd.  is looking for Electrical / Mechanical Maintenance  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Equipment Maintenance: Conducting routine inspections, testing, and maintenance of electrical systems, machinery, and equipment to ensure functionality and safety      Troubleshooting: Diagnosing electrical faults or malfunctions and implementing repairs or replacements as necessary to prevent downtime      Preventive Maintenance: Developing and executing maintenance schedules and procedures to minimize breakdowns and optimize equipment performance      Compliance and Safety: Ensuring compliance with electrical codes, standards, and safety regulations in all maintenance activities      Documentation: Maintaining accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and upgrades performed on electrical systems      Mechanical Maintenance Professional:Machinery Maintenance: Performing regular inspections, lubrication, and adjustments on mechanical equipment to maintain operational efficiency      Repairs and Troubleshooting: Identifying and rectifying mechanical issues by replacing defective parts, performing repairs, or collaborating with external service providers      Predictive Maintenance: Implementing predictive maintenance techniques, such as vibration analysis or thermal imaging, to anticipate potential breakdowns      Routine Inspections: Conducting routine checks and assessments to ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations      Inventory Management: Managing spare parts inventory and collaborating with procurement to ensure necessary parts are available for repairs      Skills and Qualifications for Maintenance Professionals:Technical Expertise: A strong understanding of electrical or mechanical systems, including troubleshooting and repair techniques      Problem-Solving Abilities: The capability to diagnose issues and develop effective solutions quickly and efficiently      Safety Awareness: Deep knowledge of safety protocols and procedures related to electrical or mechanical maintenance activities      Documentation and Record-Keeping: Keeping accurate records of maintenance activities and inspections      Analytical Skills: For interpreting equipment performance data and making informed decisions about maintenance strategies

column2: Level & Grade  - A3  Reports To  - Sr. Maintenance Manager-AFE  Job Purpose Participate and carry out maintenance, repair, troubleshooting and inspection work for the airfield lighting systems i.e., Airfield Lighting Control System, runway lighting, taxiway lighting, obstruction lighting, Apron Lighting, Airfield signage along with various security and general lighting on the airport for safety.   Principal Accountabilities Accountabilities  -    Effective Maintenance planning and ensure timely Completion.   Major Activities  -    Ensure that suitable Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) Plans are carried out for all Airfield Electrical Systems, airside buildings, security gates, mobile DG sets.  Ensure that the report is fully documented and uploaded into MAXIMO after completion of work. Schedules and prioritizes work assigned. To take care of emergency breakdowns like ALCS, runway lighting, Electrical equipment etc. Carry out the assigned work with assurance of work quality, and timely completion. To ensure the serviceability of airfield electrical system& mobile Equipments. Fault finding and defect rectification of all installations within the time frame. To ensure proper segregation of hazardous waste and non-hazardous waste. Ensure the contract SLA are monitored for carrying out the PM and CM works effectively.    Effective usage of Tools and tackles -    To carry out preventive and corrective maintenance by using appropriate tools and tackles Timely review on tools and tackles.    Spare management -    Ensures physical availability of spares and proper storage. Basic knowledge of usage of spares Timely review on spares requirements    Compliance  -   May be called out to emergencies and must be able to work overtime including nights and weekends as required. Ensure availability of all airfield electrical systems 24x7 by proper preventive maintenance Restore the facilities within the acceptable down time limits through effective corrective actions. Problem Solving: The capacity to analyze complex issues, identify root causes of problems, and devise effective solutions to minimize downtime and maintain optimal functionality.          Preventive Maintenance: Skill in developing and implementing maintenance schedules and protocols to prevent equipment failures, extend lifespan, and reduce overall maintenance costs.          Diagnostic Skills: Proficiency in using diagnostic tools and equipment to accurately assess and diagnose faults, malfunctions, and discrepancies in machinery and systems.          Communication: Effective verbal and written communication skills to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to document maintenance procedures and findings.          Attention to Detail: An eye for detail to meticulously inspect equipment, identify wear and tear, and ensure precise repairs and replacements are made.          Time Management: The ability to prioritize tasks, manage workloads, and respond promptly to urgent maintenance requests while adhering to maintenance schedules.          Safety Awareness: A strong commitment to safety protocols and regulations to ensure a safe working environment for yourself, colleagues, and other personnel.          Adaptability: The flexibility to work with a wide range of machinery and systems, as well as the capacity to quickly learn new technologies and techniques as they emerge.          Teamwork: Collaboration with other maintenance professionals, engineers, and departments to effectively address issues, share knowledge, and contribute to the overall efficiency of the organization

column2: Conduct regular inspections and preventive maintenance on plant equipment and machinery to identify potential issues and address them proactively. Perform repairs and troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems to resolve breakdowns and malfunctions promptly. Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules and procedures to maximize equipment reliability and minimize unplanned downtime. Collaborate with the production team to plan maintenance activities, ensuring minimal disruption to operations. Maintain accurate documentation of maintenance activities, including work orders, repair logs, and equipment history records. Conduct root-cause analysis on equipment failures and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new technologies in plant maintenance to enhance efficiency and optimize equipment performance. Coordinate with external service providers and contractors for specialized repairs or maintenance tasks. Ensure compliance with safety regulations and standards during maintenance activities, including lockout/tagout procedures and personal protective equipment (PPE) usage. Train and mentor junior maintenance staff to enhance their skills and knowledge in plant maintenance.  Required Skills Strong technical knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems. Proficiency in using various tools and equipment for troubleshooting and repair. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills to identify and resolve complex equipment issues. Knowledge of preventive maintenance principles and practices. Ability to read and interpret technical manuals, schematics, and blueprints. Strong attention to detail and ability to work with precision. Effective communication skills to interact with team members and external vendors. Time management and organizational skills to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge of safety regulations and protocols

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Electrical Maintenance Engineer to join our Maintenance Department in Sari. The ideal candidate should possess a Diploma or Degree in Electrical Engineering and have 2 to 3 years of hands-on experience in electrical maintenance, particularly within the utility, press shop, CNC, and VMC machines. The candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the optimal functioning of electrical systems and equipment, contributing to the efficiency and productivity of our operations. Key Responsibilities: 1. Electrical Maintenance: Perform routine, preventive, and corrective maintenance on electrical systems and equipment, including utility, press shop, CNC, and VMC machines. Diagnose and troubleshoot electrical issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution to minimize downtime. Conduct regular inspections and testing of electrical systems to ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations. 2. Installation and Upgrades: Assist in the installation, commissioning, and upgrading of electrical systems and equipment. Collaborate with engineering and production teams to implement electrical modifications and improvements. 3. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including maintenance logs, service reports, and equipment performance data. Prepare and submit maintenance reports to the Maintenance Manager, highlighting any critical issues or areas for improvement. 4. Safety and Compliance: Adhere to all safety protocols and procedures while performing maintenance tasks. Ensure compliance with electrical codes, standards, and regulations in all maintenance activities. 5. Continuous Improvement: Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance maintenance practices and processes. Stay updated with industry trends, advancements, and best practices in electrical maintenance. Qualifications and Skills: Education: Diploma or Degree in Electrical Engineering. Experience: Minimum of 2 to 3 years experience in electrical maintenance, specifically within utility, press shop, CNC, and VMC machines. Experience in the engineering and sheet metal industries is preferred. Technical Skills: Strong knowledge of electrical systems, circuits, and components. Proficient in diagnosing and troubleshooting electrical issues. Experience with maintenance management software and tools. Soft Skills: Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Strong communication and teamwork abilities. Attention to detail and a proactive approach to maintenance. Working Conditions: Full-time position based in Sari. May require working in shifts or extended hours based on maintenance needs. Physical ability to perform maintenance tasks, including lifting, climbing, and working in confined spaces.

column2: With the skilled and experienced Compressor Maintenance Engineer to join our maintenance team     The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure the efficient and reliable operation of compressors within our facilities     The ideal candidate will have a strong mechanical aptitude, electrical troubleshooting skills, and a proactive approach to preventive maintenance                   Responsibilities:         Conduct routine inspections of compressor systems to identify signs of wear, damage, or malfunction.     Perform preventive maintenance tasks, including lubrication, filter replacement, and alignment checks, according to manufacturer guidelines and maintenance schedules.     Troubleshoot compressor issues using diagnostic tools and techniques to identify root causes and implement corrective actions.     Repair or replace defective components, such as valves, bearings, seals, and electrical controls, to restore compressor functionality.     Perform compressor overhauls and rebuilds as necessary to extend equipment lifespan and maintain performance efficiency.     Monitor compressor performance metrics, such as temperature, pressure, and vibration levels, and take corrective actions to optimize operation.     Collaborate with production and engineering teams to coordinate compressor maintenance activities and minimize downtime impact on operations.     Document maintenance activities, including work performed, parts used, and equipment condition, in maintenance management systems or logs.     Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies during maintenance activities, including lockout/tagout procedures and use of personal protective equipment.     Provide technical support and guidance to junior maintenance technicians or operators on compressor operation and maintenance best practices.         Qualifications:         Bachelors degree or diploma in mechanical engineering, or a related field preferred equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.     Proven experience at least 15-18 year in compressor maintenance, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing environment.     Strong understanding of compressor principles, including reciprocating, rotary screw, and centrifugal compressors, as well as associated control systems.     Proficiency in reading and interpreting technical manuals, diagrams, and schematics to troubleshoot and repair equipment.     Hands-on experience with maintenance tools and equipment, including wrenches, meters, gauges, and precision instruments.     Familiarity with predictive maintenance techniques, such as vibration analysis, thermography, and oil analysis, is a plus.     Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to diagnose complex mechanical and electrical issues.     Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with team members, vendors, and management.     Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.     Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and on-call rotations, to support maintenance operations.
column11: Diagnostics, Mechanical, Valves, Troubleshooting, Technical support, Preventive maintenance, Electricals, Maintenance management, Predictive maintenance, Thermography

Your expertise will contribute to the optimization of biogas production processes, enhancing plant efficiency and sustainability.       Key Responsibilities:       1. Instrumentation Installation: Install, configure, and calibrate a wide range of instrumentation devices such as flow meters, pressure sensors, temperature sensors, level sensors, and analytical instruments.     2. Control Systems: Program, maintain, and troubleshoot PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers) and SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems to ensure accurate and reliable plant control.     3. Preventive Maintenance: Develop and execute preventive maintenance plans for instrumentation and control systems to minimize downtime and equipment failures.     4. Calibration and Validation: Regularly calibrate and validate instrumentation equipment to maintain accuracy and compliance with industry standards.     5. Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve issues related to instrumentation and control systems to minimize production interruptions.     6. Data Analysis: Analyze data collected from instrumentation systems to identify trends and areas for improvement in plant performance.     7. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of instrumentation maintenance activities, calibration logs, and equipment manuals.     8. Safety Compliance: Ensure that all instrumentation systems comply with safety regulations and industry standards.     9. Training: Provide training to plant operators and technicians on the proper use and maintenance of instrumentation equipment.       Qualifications:       - Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.   - Proven experience in the operation and maintenance of instrumentation and control systems in a similar industrial environment, preferably in the renewable energy or biogas sector.   - Proficiency in PLC programming and SCADA systems.   - Strong knowledge of instrumentation devices, their installation, calibration, and troubleshooting.   - Familiarity with safety protocols and regulations in an industrial setting.   - Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.   - Strong communication and teamwork skills.   - Ability to work independently and in a team, often in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.   - Flexibility to work on-call and respond to plant emergencies as needed.       Preferred Qualifications:       - Professional certification in instrumentation or control systems.   - Experience with biogas production processes or renewable energy systems.   - Knowledge of data analysis and reporting tools.   - Familiarity with maintenance management software.
column11: Data analysis, Renewable energy, PLC, instrumentation maintenance, Sensors, Preventive maintenance, Reporting tools, SCADA, Maintenance management, Instrumentation engineering

column2: Equipment Maintenance: Oversee the maintenance and repair of machinery, equipment, and systems within the plant     Preventive Maintenance: Develop and implement preventive maintenance programs to minimize unplanned downtime and equipment failures     Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve equipment malfunctions, electrical issues, and mechanical problems in a timely manner     Safety Compliance: Ensure that all equipment and machinery meet safety regulations and standards, and that safety protocols are followed     Spare Parts Management: Manage and maintain an inventory of spare parts, tools, and materials required for maintenance and repairs     Budget Management: Develop and manage the maintenance budget, tracking expenses and optimizing costs     Technical Documentation: Maintain detailed records, logs, and documentation related to maintenance activities, repairs, and equipment history     Team Supervision: Oversee a team of maintenance technicians, providing guidance, training, and performance evaluations     Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and cost reductions, and implement best practices for maintenance     Emergency Response: Develop and implement emergency response plans for equipment breakdowns or critical failures     Regulatory Compliance: Ensure the plant complies with environmental regulations, quality standards, and industry-specific regulations
column11: Spares management, Quality standards, Regulatory compliance, Budget management, Equipment maintenance, Troubleshooting, Continuous improvement, Preventive maintenance, Technical documentation

column2: 1. HVAC Engineer - Facilities Maintenance : Graduate in Engineering/Technology from reputed Institution in Mechanical Discipline with Minimum 8+ Years of Experience in Building Services Operation and Maintenance/Facilities Management (Hard FM) Services. Capable of Technical and Administrative Management and lead the Team of Supervisors and Technicians.  Role & responsibilities   Technical Knowledge and Work Experience for all Maintenance & repair activities of Centralized Air Conditioning System, Air Cooled Chillers, Air Handling Units, Chilled Water System, Package Units, Split Package Units, Industrial Type Split Units, VRV Units and Domestic Type units. Preparing Plant Preventive Maintenance (PPM) schedule as per Manufacturers recommendations of Plant, Machinery and Equipment and as required. Carryout any Breakdown immediately up to the satisfaction of the end user. Knowledge of Refrigerants and their properties phased out Refrigerants, Global Warming, and procedure to dispose of unwanted Refrigerants, Liquids and gases. Knowledge of productive measures to reduce noise, vibration and sound level. Knowledge of Building Management System (BMS). Responsible for ensuring that, Maintenance resources provide a productive, efficient and cost effective execution of Maintenance schedules across work area. Implements programs and procedures required to ensure plant, Machineries and Equipment cleanliness. Reviews the operation of Plant, Machineries, equipment and systems constantly to minimize unplanned downtime, anticipate solve problems in a timely manner and to identify opportunities for improvements. Maintains a computerized maintenance management system for tracking work orders, spare parts, and maintenance history of plant, machineries and equipment. Prepares reports, analysis data and makes recommendations for improving plant, Machineries, equipment operations and solving maintenance related problems. Maintains Safety, Health and environmental policies and procedures. English communication is must & computer operation like MS office , excel, power points should be thorough. 2. HVAC Supervisor - Facilities Maintenance : Diploma in Air-Conditioning / Mechanical Engineering with minimum 5 years experience in Operation and Maintenance of Central AC Plants, with latest electronics controls. Exposure to other electro-mechanical equipment maintenance shall be an added advantage. Good English communication & computer operation is required

column2: 1. Mechanical Engineer - Facilities Maintenance  :  Graduate Engineer in Mechanical engineering with 7+ years experience in Facilities Maintenance services (MEP) jobs for Oil field, large buildings, commercial properties, facilities. Gulf Experience will be an added advantage. Should possess hands-on experience in the effective management of different types of Maintenance Contracts including Integrated Facilities Management Contracts, Specialist Service Contracts etc., ensuring compliance with industry standards. Role & responsibilities   Overall responsible for operation and comprehensive maintenance contracts of FM MEP Services. Should handle mechanical pumps, Swimming pool & their equipment's, Plumbing systems, motorized valves, PRV, block valves, water tank, float valve gauging systems, diesel driven pumps, generators, air compressor, Sewage networks, Sewage lifting stations, Irrigation plant, booster pump, portable water & their storage systems, TSE storage systems, drain line & Troubleshooting. Exposure to other Mechanical equipment maintenance shall be an added advantage. Should be able to lead a service team for Operations & Maintenance of Mechanical systems. Implement the Annual Maintenance for Mechanical equipment and follow the set procedures in order to achieve the target PPM completion schedule. Oversee the maintenance activities related to Mechanical Maintenance contracts and inspect completed work of the same to ensure conformance to OEM standards. Oversee various Mechanical testing on all equipment to safeguard the Equipment with regard to their operational longevity. Manage the availability of necessary Maintenance tools and equipments in order for the maintenance team to execute tasks in an effective manner. Manage the audit on the technical aspect of maintenance spares to ensure their relevance with current requirements and desired specifications. Ensure that all preventative maintenance programs comply with the company Policies and Procedures. Ensure that all analysis and troubleshooting activities are conducted in line with the set policies and procedures. Monitor the replacement activities of all Mechanical systems that cannot be repaired. Ensure on-the-job safety standards/practices by adhering to the company Quality Standards through the maintenance of a clean and safe work area.  Ensure timely resolvent and settlement of complaints to ensure prompt and efficient resolution of all customer enquiries. Perform ad-hoc and other duties related to the job as assigned by the Direct Manager.  Prepare and submit reports to the Direct Manager covering all the Maintenance activities (Mechanical maintenance) conducted in both commercial and residential settings which include identification of potential problems, as well as recommendations for corrective action on a regular basis. Conduct TBT & safety meeting for co-worker. Able to make monthly reports covering site activity 2. Mechanical Supervisor - Facilities Maintenance  : Diploma Engineer in Mechanical engineering with 5+ years experience in Facilities Maintenance services (MEP) jobs for Oil field, large buildings, commercial properties, facilities. Gulf Experience will be an added advantage. Should possess hands-on experience in the effective management of different types of Operation and Maintenance of CHW pumps , booster pumps, plumbing systems, irrigation plant & it system ,PRV, Butterfly valve, PICV valves. Should be able to guide team for Pump Overhauling , motor overhauling & pump set alignments. Exposure to other electro-mechanical equipment maintenance shall be an added advantage.  Good English communication & computer operation is required

column2: Job Summary The mission, vision, and values of a Maintenance Engineer are to monitor the continuous running of equipment and machinery, perform routine maintenance, organize repairs, and occasionally be involved in the manufacture of items that aid in maintenance. The focus is on efficiency, development, and progress within manufacturing and processing industries. Maintenance engineers collaborate on modifications to plants and equipment to ensure optimal operating capacity based on received data, proposing modifications to preventive maintenance schedules. Role & responsibilities     Planning and executing new installations and changeovers on production lines. Creating 3D/2D drawings of machine parts using SolidWorks or AutoCAD. Planning for new machine mechanical spare parts and procuring them from suppliers. Assembling and installing new Special Purpose Machines (SPM) lines and equipment. Proficient in pneumatic systems, bearings, vacuum pumps, and precise mechanical alignment on high-speed automatic machines. Familiarity with sensors, encoders, servo and stepper motors, and maintaining all related software and programs. Troubleshooting mechanical problems and rectifying machine design issues to enhance maintenance and prolong machine part lifespan. Developing operating procedures and documenting best practices for easy troubleshooting. Education: B.Tech in Electrical/Electronics. Experience: 4+ years of experience in maintaining Special Purpose Machines (SPMs). Other Details: Hands-on experience with AutoCAD.

column2: Job Title   :  Engineer - Operations Reporting   :  Cluster Operations Manager Job Location   :  Chennai / Kochi / Nagpur Position Summary:   The position is responsible for managing end-to-end execution including DISCOM related work of residential Rooftop solar projects. This position includes planning, co-ordination required for carrying out timely execution of projects, close I&C contractor management, with a high focus on Safety, execution Quality, and customer hand over process.  Objective of this Role include:  1. Identify and engage with Installer partners to ensure correct expectations are set in terms of their turn-out/PPE compliance at site and most importantly disciplined manner of carrying out quality rooftop solar installation.  2. Timely execution of projects by planning and coordinating with DISCOM personnel and internal stakeholders during the life cycle till commissioning of power plants. 3. Expect good record keeping of project related applications, approvals, and agreements or any relevant document associated with the project. 4. Facilitate Safety and quality audits of plant as and when necessary. All plants would undergo a quality check before successfully handing over to the maintenance team. Position Responsibility  Facilitate Safety and Quality related aspects with effective audits and compliance at highest level.  Drive execution of the projects, keeping them on schedule and on budget, while maintaining relationship with clients, stakeholders, and other internal stakeholders. Strong organization, prioritization, and time management skills to monitor and handle multiple tasks at the same time, balance key priorities and meet challenging and changing deadlines.  Delivery mindset (on time, on budget, in quality); high thoroughness and reliability, ability to deliver quality output. Be responsible for identify and onboard new Installer partners and have the best engagement with partners for smooth carrying out projects within the stipulated timelines. Be responsible to coordinate with DISCOM offices for the projects underway and make sure the services of technical feasibility, load changes and commissioning related net metering activities are carried out smoothly and in planned manner. Academic qualification :  B.E./ B. Tech (Electrical)  or  Diploma (Electrical) with a minimum of 2 years or more experience in Solar industry. Experience:  1-3 years of experience in the Solar Energy field or Projects Installations / O&M.  Desired Technical Skills:  Understanding of Solar Operations & Maintenance scheduling, procedures, and Techniques  MIS  reporting and Dashboard Installation  experience in the solar PV industry. In-depth understanding of Solar PV plant components, trouble-shooting techniques. Good understanding of DISCOM associated works for Solar power plants. Desired Soft Skills:  High resilience, proactive problem-solving skills and strong negotiation skills       Strong ability to prioritise tasks in a highly dynamic environment.  Excellent communication, planning and organizing skills  Language Proficiency:  English,  Regional language (Tamil or Malayalam or Marathi) and HIndi Desirable
