column2: Role & responsibilities     Electrical Maintenance Management:  Oversee the maintenance of all electrical, and electronic systems and machinery, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal performance. Greenfield Project Execution:   Lead the setup and commissioning of electrical systems for the new manufacturing plant, ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory standards. Preventive Maintenance:  Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules for all electrical equipment to reduce the risk of breakdowns and ensure smooth operations. Troubleshooting and Repairs:  Quickly diagnose and resolve electrical/PLC issues in machinery and equipment to minimize production interruptions. Automation and Upgradation:  Enhance manufacturing processes through the integration and maintenance of advanced automation systems, including PLCs, servo drives, robotics, and other automated technologies. Safety and Compliance:   Ensure all electrical work complies with relevant safety standards and regulations, conducting regular inspections and risk assessments. Vendor Management:  Coordinate with suppliers and contractors for the procurement and      maintenance of electrical components and services. Team Leadership:  Supervise and train a team of electrical maintenance technicians,      fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence. Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain detailed records of maintenance activities, equipment performance, and repair histories, generating regular reports for management review. Budget Management:  Manage the electrical maintenance budget, optimizing costs while ensuring     high standards of equipment reliability and performance. Cross-functional Collaboration:  Work closely with other departments, such as production, quality, and procurement, to support overall plant operations and continuous improvement initiatives. Energy Management:   Implement energy-efficient practices and technologies to reduce power consumption and enhance sustainability efforts within the plant. Preferred candidate profile     Education:   BE Graduate in Electrical/Electronics/Mechatronics  Engineering with 8 to 15 years of  experience in manufacturing engineering, with a focus on greenfield projects . Experience:       In the Engineering/Hydraulics Manufacturing Industry. Technical Skills :   Basic understanding of PLCs- Allen Bradley, Siemens, Mitsubishi of ladder diagram, Servo Drives, Robotics, pneumatics, hydraulic and automation lines, and other systems. Hands-on Experience:  Working experience in CNC, VMC servo drives, Welding, Semi-Automated  Assembly lines, Testing lines, and Painting booths.   Skills and Attributes: Strong knowledge of electrical systems and components used in a manufacturing environment. Experience with greenfield projects,      including setup and commissioning of new facilities. Proficiency in troubleshooting and maintaining      CNC, VMC machines, welding equipment, semi-automated assembly lines,      testing lines, and paint booths. Ability to work with PLCs, servo drives, robotics, pneumatics, hydraulics, and automation systems. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure. Strong leadership and team management capabilities. Good communication and interpersonal skills. If you are a proactive and experienced maintenance professional with a passion for driving operational excellence and innovation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Canara Hydraulics Pvt. Ltd.   To apply, please send your resume to nvbillava@canarahydraulics.com along with a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you would be an excellent fit for the role of Assistant Manager  Maintenance at Canara Hydraulics Pvt. Ltd. Perks and benefits    Salary will be structured to meet their Competence and Experience
column11: Machine Maintenance, MTTR, Vmc Maintenance, Breakdown Maintenance, Utility Maintenance, Plant Maintenance, PLC, Plant Automation, Servo Drives, Robotics, MTBF, CNC Maintenance, Predictive Maintenance, Preventive Maintenance, Machine Shop Maintenance, Mitsubishi of ladder diagram

Manage      the team on technical best practice and establish standard policies and      procedures whilst also mentoring and leading the department.  Implement      and manage continuous improvement and modern manufacturing principals by      highlighting deficiencies and recommending changes in training, working      practices and processes. Strategy and Development Contribute to the creation and      implementation of best practice maintenance vision, strategy, policies,      processes and procedures to aid and improve operational performance Contribute to new business initiatives      and projects and review and communicate the impact on Maintenance      activities. Preferred candidate profile    Responsible for ensuring that the facilities, layout and machinery used to produce new and existing materials and goods run to their maximum efficiency and output. Includes total preventive maintenance, managing breakdowns of mechanical, electrical and robotic equipment (including software programming). Includes people management and budgetary/cost reporting. Adhering to IATF requirements. Support and coach the Maintenance team to achieve the targeted results towards to meet the organization goals. Conducting regular meeting with team and guide them wherever the support is required by co-ordinating with top management team. column2: An Assistant Engineer plays a vital role in supporting engineering projects and assisting senior engineers in various tasks      They provide technical expertise, contribute to project planning, and assist in the execution of engineering activities      The specific responsibilities and requirements may vary depending on the industry and company, but here is a general overview of an Assistant Engineer's       Responsibilities:        Technical Support: Assist senior engineers in analyzing project requirements, conducting research, and providing technical support for engineering projects      Design and Development: Contribute to the design and development of engineering solutions by preparing drawings, schematics, and technical specifications under the guidance of senior engineers      Documentation: Prepare technical reports, project documentation, and progress updates      Maintain accurate records of engineering activities, including test results, measurements, and observations      Project Planning: Assist in project planning activities, including cost estimation, resource allocation, and scheduling      Collaborate with the project team to ensure timely and efficient project execution      Testing and Quality Assurance: Support testing and quality assurance activities by assisting in conducting tests, analyzing data, and identifying and resolving issues or discrepancies      Equipment and Materials: Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to procure required equipment, materials, and components      Assist in evaluating and selecting appropriate equipment and materials for projects      Safety and Compliance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations and industry standards      Identify potential safety hazards and assist in implementing preventive measures      Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams, including engineers, technicians, and project managers      Communicate project updates, progress, and challenges to stakeholders      Professional Development: Stay updated with advancements in engineering technologies, industry standards, and best practices      Seek opportunities for professional development and enhance technical skills        Skills and Qualifications:        Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field      Specific engineering disciplines may vary depending on the industry (eg, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, etc)      Solid understanding of engineering principles, concepts, and practices      Proficiency in engineering software, tools, and applications relevant to the field      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills      Excellent organizational and time management abilities      Attention to detail and accuracy in work      Effective communication and teamwork skills      Ability to adapt to changing project requirements and work in a dynamic environment      Knowledge of safety regulations and compliance standards      Prior experience or internships in engineering-related roles is advantageous but not always required
column11: Manager Quality Assurance, Compliance, Time management, Analytical, Resource allocation, Engineering projects, Cost estimation, Project planning, Scheduling, Technical support

column2: 1.      Preventive Maintenance:          Plan preventive maintains in coordination with production team for Zero Breakdown and ensure 100% availability of machines and equipments.      Drive technical changes in preventive maintenance by considering the breakdown maintenance.      Verifying Preventive Maintenance check sheet on daily & weekly basis to ensure PM as per the plan      Making machine /Equipment available for preventive maintenance as per plan.      Verifying equipment inspection check sheets to identify abnormalities and taking the necessary action to overcome on that abnormalities by making required part available, installation of part & servicing of that equipment / machine.      Doing MTBF (Mean Time Between Failure) & MTTR (Mean Time to Repair) analysis and taking counter measure actions      Following and updating TBM calendar for timely basis inspection to increase the life of spare part and machine equipment.      Should align all the plan according to Quality Systems Requirements      Club visits of Manufacturers /AMC provider during PM schedule          2.      Breakdown Maintenance          Attending the major breakdown maintenance to understand the exact problem by doing why-why analysis for taking counter measures      Guide for counter measure activity after breakdown analysis like, restoring the defective parts & removing the abnormalities, taking trail of equipment to ensure normal functioning of the equipment etc.      Review and analyze the day to day breakdown report & providing guidance to team as and when required.      Monthly review of break down report to understand the occurrence & root cause for reducing MTTR & increasing MTBF.      Prepare / suggest counter measure to prevent occurrence of the same problem/abnormality & ensure Horizontally deployment of the same through maintenance engineer.      Develop local service provider for small repair Job in accord with Purchase          3.      Spares Management          Identifying critical and non-critical spare parts & time to time updating the spare part list as per requirement.      Management of Spare part for consumable spares, Wearing spares, electronic spares & electrical switch gears.      Controlling consumption of consumable, spare part and stock items.      Identification of Indigenous spare part for cost reduction          4.      Cost Saving & Energy Conservation          Reducing inventory and saving cost by converting imported to indigenous, refurbishing and reuse, developing local vendors & alternate sources, also by inventing newest technology useful for company      Interacting with service engineers & doing market research to identify the low cost & long-life parts & materials to reduce the cost of material and parts.      Reducing service cost by inhouse training of maintenance team.      Identifying the power wastage & plan for energy conservation through reduction of energy consumption, reuse of energy, circuit modification, using natural resources & alternate energy efficient resources.          5.      Modification & Upgradation          Identifying absolute & old equipment s, machinery, spare parts and upgrading them as per new technology      Upgrade and improve absolute machines though system modification as per the customer s requirements and KAIZEN.      Modification of the machine for improving MTTR & MTBF through analysis of past breakdowns and week design identification.      Providing advance tools like Bearing pooler, hydraulic Jack, hydraulic trollies, lifter, multi-function meters to reduce breakdown hours.      Should have small team to perform all Kaizen ideas, suggestions safety requirements          6.      Manpower Management & Training          Prepare manpower plan & weekly shift schedule & Monitor shift wise manpower availability & take necessary actions in case of manpower shortage to avoid productivity loss.      Identify & escalate disciplinary issues to eliminate further losses.      Identification of technical & soft skill requirements to develop and train manpower accordingly.      Training existing & new manpower on system implementation.          7.      Vendor & Service Management          Identify and develop compatible vendors for service solutions, Machine Upgradation, Tool Room requirements, electronic services and upgradation & coordinating with vendors on timely basis to resolve problems, changing parameters Taking follow-up for payment of vendor          8.      System Implementation and documentation          Implementing systems like QMS, IATF, TS, 5S, TPM, DWM. Preparing the documentation and presentation of the same as per Statutory Requirement, audit requirement, management review, value working.      Reviewing and maintaining records of all maintenance related activities in SAP      Comply and percolate the statutory reequipments like OSHAS, EMS, Safety, MSEB.      Support in analysis of extracted IOT data and produce actionable insights for decision making          Qualifications          Minimum Qualification required: DEE/DME + 15 years of Exp.      Qualifications preferred: BE Mechanical /Electrical/ Electronics with 10+ years of Exp.          Work Experience:          10-15 years of experience with CNC, PLC, Hydraulics and Pneumatics, Utility, Induction Heating, Heat Treatment, Pelting, Machine, Furnace, press, robot, Induction, utility & related equipment nitriding.      Industry Related experience: Automotive metallic component, Engineering Manufacturing Industry          Soft skills/Competencies:          Trouble shooting of electrical and mechanical failures      Analysis of failures and finding root causes      Basic knowledge of mechanical, Electricals & Electronics equipment      Basics knowledge of Computer and its Hardware in case of IoT maintenance      Special Purpose Machine and its breakdown handling      PLC Circuits development      Problem solving      Lean Manufacturing One Line Flow

column2: Overall, the role of a Control & Instrumentation Engineer is to design, integrate, maintain, and optimize control systems and instrumentation to ensure the safe and efficient operation of manufacturing machinery & processes     As C&I Engineer you are responsible for the reliability and performance of the manufacturing systems, as well as compliance with industry standards and regulations     This role will be responsible for Leading Control & Automation Initiatives & Projects     You will lead maintenance activities related to control and instrumentation systems like troubleshooting, preventive maintenance, calibration, programming & modification along with routine shift activities, while working closely with other functions, including Process, Production, Quality, EHS, Supply Chain, Procurement and Finance & Accounting     You will be part of the Plant Maintenance team & report to the Assistant Manager_ Maintenance     You will be reported by Shift technicians (OTMs) and working in shifts       YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:         Design and Development: You will be responsible for designing and developing control systems and instrumentation for the entire manufacturing facility. You will work on specifying the requirements, selecting appropriate equipment, and creating system designs that meet the operational needs of the manufacturing plant.         System Integration: You will integrate various control systems and instrumentation components within the manufacturing environment & ensure seamless communication and coordination between different devices, such as sensors, actuators, programmable logic controllers (PLCs), distributed control systems (DCS), human-machine interfaces (HMIs), and supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems.         Installation and Commissioning: You will oversee the installation and commissioning of control systems and instrumentation in the manufacturing facility & work closely with technicians and contractors to ensure proper installation, wiring, and calibration of instruments. You will conduct testing and debugging to ensure that the systems are functioning correctly.         Maintenance and Troubleshooting: You will be responsible for the ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting of control systems and instrumentation & monitor the performance of the systems, identify any malfunctions or anomalies, and take corrective actions to ensure smooth operation. This includes periodic calibration, preventive maintenance, and addressing issues that may arise during the manufacturing process.         Safety and Compliance: You will play a crucial role in ensuring safety and compliance within the manufacturing facility & will implement safety measures and protocols related to control systems and instrumentation to mitigate risks and prevent accidents. You will ensure that the systems comply with relevant industry standards, regulations, and quality control guidelines.         System Upgrades and Optimization: You will continuously assess the performance of control systems and instrumentation and identify opportunities for improvement. This includes proposing and implementing system upgrades, enhancements, and optimization strategies to enhance efficiency, productivity, and overall process performance in the manufacturing plant.         Documentation and Training: You will maintain accurate documentation of control systems, instrumentation configurations, and standard operating procedures. You will create technical manuals, guidelines, and training materials to facilitate the understanding and effective use of control systems and instrumentation by operators and maintenance personnel.         WHAT WE WILL BE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:               BE / BTech Instrumentation and Control Engineering with an overall experience of 5-10 years in Plant Maintenance and specialization in Automation & Contro
column11: Procurement, Supply chain, EHS, Automation, Instrumentation, Manager Quality Control, Troubleshooting, Preventive maintenance, SCADA

Job Summary:    As Project Manager aftermarket you will secure and drive the aftermarket business (Uptime and Maintainability) and deliveries in GTT initiatives with mission to bring quality in product and technology development from aftermarket market perspective and ensure aftermarket business growth              ?       The primary focus area for Maintainability Engineer will be            Contribute to an optimized Maintainability Cost for an assigned product, technology, or component          Influence on the design by strong personal relationship with engineering departments (VE & PE)          Very strong early-phase mindset and a strong knowledge of customer needs, competitor offer, aftermarket products and services            The overall responsibilities of the Maintainability Engineer are:            Analyse Product and Project information, for early evaluation of technical solutions from maintainability perspective.          Lead early analysis & actively take part in failure mode analysis to define repair and diagnostics strategy.              Gather input about customer needs (product targets) and translate into quantifiable product and technology requirements for maintainability.          Breakdown requirements to ensure delivery of expected maintainability cost at complete vehicle level.          Lead the feature at component level within multiple technology sub-streams and vehicle development teams to balance and harmonize requirements.          Support competitor vehicle analysis, gather data and provide input to feature road maps.          Visualize maintenance cost to verify the feature level agreed in Feature roadmap for respective technology area.          Co-develop and evaluate the technology/product solutions with the solution providers within multiple technology streams to ensure development of an optimized solution for maintainability cost,          Identify and document risks. Use Score card to document Friday to Monday comparisons. Support Intro block / project (epic) validation.          Give input and gather DfAM/ MCC (FF, part costs, VST)/ SIM / M-value for a specific technology area, as a base for ME risk assessment & prioritization over time. column1: Senior Maintenance Engineer - Water and Waste Water
column2: I) JOB PURPOSE   BIAL provides high standard reliability of its infrastructure, equipment and systems; Water & wastewater is an important system in making Bangalore International Airport a highly reliable world-class airport. Assists his superior in ensuring readiness and availability of the water & wastewater system wrt terminal building & non-terminal building areas on a 365/7/24 basis. Main challenge will be to instill high safety awareness, pro-active and customer-focused maintenance attitude, and shortest-possible response-times. Routine daily inspection for checking the healthiness of system. Quality Assurance of job carried out with regards to maintenance. Plan & supervision of preventive/corrective maintenance works. Ready to attend break down maintenance in least response time. Documentation and Reporting of maintenance activities. Effective supervision of works being executed through outsourced agencies. To ensure the serviceability of all mechanical installations to facilitate adequacy in passenger comfort.   II) PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES & MAJOR ACTIVITIES a) Maintenance   Critical systems like Potable, Raw water & Sewer system to be maintained. Maintenance of system like RO, UV, Filters (Disc, screen, UF, DMF and Bag filters), chlorine dosing and Ozonation system. Proactive & customer focused maintenance attitude. Process knowledge wrt pumping & its related systems. Leading the shift maintenance team to attend maintenance like preventive/corrective/breakdown with ease. b) Planning & scheduling Preventive maintenance activity to be planned based on system requirement & SAP schedule.  Scheduling of maintenance activity should be planned based on time/concern technical personnel availability/spares/tools tackles/equipment. .c) Documentation Maintenance related documentation to be updated in SAP as and when required. Water test reports to be documented based on IATA rules & regulations. Ensuring all the drawings & documents related to water supply & sewer network are available at working locations for quick reference. Ensuring the instruments & equipment has valid calibration. Supporting inventory management & maintaining of IMS documents. d) Safety  Safety has to be integral part during any maintenance activity. Ensure adherence to all safety regulations of all system, according to BIAL's safety concept. To maintain zero percent accident/incident. e) Compliance Track adherence to agreed service levels by contractors/Vendors. Initiate quality and continuous improvement initiatives. III) JOB SPECIFICATION   a)  Education qualification and certifications  BE in Mechanical/Chemical  Diploma in Mechanical/Chemical   b)  Years of Experience Minimum Experience: 6 years of total experience for BE. 8 year for Diploma holders with a deep understanding of Water & wastewater systems activities. c)  Computer skills  Basic MS office includes Excel, Power Points, Word, and Windows.  Hands on experience on SAP PM Module, IBM Maximo. Auto CAD. d)  Knowledge and work skills  Knowledge on water supply system, especially on Water supply system/ETP/STP/WTP. Deft in various types of pumps and its maintenance. Knowledge on filtration systems, Disinfection system. Commitment towards high quality, sense for improvement and optimization. Excellent communication skills both verbal & written. Ability to remain calm and to retain the overview in crisis situations. knowledge on VFD systems. Valid Four-wheeler driving license required.
column11: water and waste water, water supply, filtration systems, SAP PM, ETP, WTP, IBM maximo, VFD, waste water, maximo, STP

column2: Brief Role :  Mechanical Engineer -  Hydro Power   Job Description     Responsible for supervising the installation and overhauling of Francis turbines in Naghlu Dam.	 Mechanical Erection supervision works related erection and commissioning and supervision for all project activities under this contract. 	 The review of existing Hydro power Plant equipment,  specifications,  implementation schedule,  drawings,  diagrams,  etc.,  review/ approval of Rehabilitation submittals.	 Attend the energy meetings as requested by De Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat (DABS),  and provide comments as required. Keep close coordination with all stakeholders to implement the project.	 Responsible for the general overhauling which will be based on systematic disassembly of components for: accurate diagnosis,  repair or replacement of damaged components,  resetting of design tolerances or alignment,  fastening or bracing loosen parts,  improvement of safety criteria,  as practical,  cleaning,  surface treatment and painting,  re- assembly,  testing.	 Overall responsibility throughout the contract duration in supervising the project team,  ensuring quality of project management and preparation/ implementation projects included in the contract. 	 Overall responsibility for management of the Technical and Operational activities of the project including: project planning and implementation,  assessment,  monitoring,  evaluation,  training and quality works.	 Responsible for the overall project activities and deliverable.	 Ensure that all programming,  administrative and logistical tasks are promptly and correctly completed in accordance with DABS/ World Bank (WB) policies,  procedures and guidelines.	 Ensure that all program data are accurately collected and reported.	 Representation of the project to internal and external stakeholders.	 Review available studies,  reports and other documents relating to Naghlu Power Plant.	 Review all available data,  information and plans concerning the Plant.	 Request client for topographical,  hydrological and other data required.	 Review all documents prepared by prospective Contractor for Naghlu Hydro Power Project UNIT#1 which includes:	 Requirements as directed by DABS for a Quality Control Plan (QCP),  Environmental Mitigation and Monitoring Plan,  Rehabilitation Risk Management Plan establishing a "base- line" of prior existing conditions on the work sites and those areas adjacent or otherwise,  to the Work sites which can be affected in some manner by the work activities,  etc.  Industry: Other Functional Area: Other Role:Other   Desired Candidate Profile Education-  UG: B.Sc PG:MS/ M.Sc(Science) -  Mechanical Engineering Doctorate:Doctorate Not Required Please refer to the Job description above
